Exaggerate: The claim of Joe Biden faking an interview in front of a green screen is an exaggeration as there is no evidence to support this assertion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the allegation of Joe Biden faking an interview in front of a green screen.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the strange movement of Biden's hands in front of the microphones is proof of a green screen, which is a problematic assumption without further evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation for the strange movement of Biden's hands, suggesting that it is due to the long booms holding the microphones, which give the illusion of something amiss.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that reporters were present during the interview, as confirmed by a Voice of America reporter who was holding one of the microphones.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
